definitions: An assessment of the creditworthiness of an individual, company, or country, based on their financial history and capacity to repay debt.
A score or grade assigned to an individual or entity that indicates their ability to meet financial obligations.
examples: Her excellent credit rating helped her secure a low-interest loan.
The company's credit rating was downgraded after a series of financial losses.
A good credit rating is essential for obtaining mortgages and other forms of credit.
